intro: Clidemia cruegeriana, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a shrub or small tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has a rugged, twisted trunk and is often found growing in coastal and lowland areas. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and threats from invasive species, it is considered a vulnerable species.
